page.title: 03FARMING
page.content: Good general arable heathland. Lowfields,heavy clay &"blow away"sand. Extensive use of fertilisers & sprays. 4 year rotation wheat/barley/beet/ barley .Oilseed rape good cash crop. Peas & potatoes on contract.Most farms are mechanically independent with say 7 tractors, 2 combines, huge reversible multi-furrowed plough, etc. LIVESTOCK:Beef & store cattle raised on slope & lowfield pastures. Friesian or Hereford/Friesian mated with Charolais bull are the main breeds. MARKETS:Largest Sleaford,Newark for cattle buying,Lincoln & Grantham. Spring barley for malting.Beet taken to Bardney sugar factory in winter Campaign. 1985:Crop quality reduced by excessive May & June rains,frequent high winds & continuous lack of sunshine.Constant use of grain driers raised costs.
